text.textblock: Big Sandy Corridor Unit That Portion Lying Within Hardin and Tyler Counties
Part of A-87 within Hardin County described as follows: Beginning at the Northeast corner of said A-87; Thence, S. 02
’ E., 800 feet, along the East line of A-87; Thence, N. 83

’ W., 1200 feet, along the West line of said A-87, to a point on the North line of Hardin County; Thence, East, 1000 feet along the North line of Hardin County; Thence, Southerly, approximately 800 feet along the westerly gradient boundary of Village Creek, to the Point of Beginning.

Also, a part of A-87 within Tyler County, Beginning at the Northwest corner of said A-87; Thence, Easterly, approximately 1000 feet, along the southerly gradient boundary of Village Creek; Thence, West, 1000 feet, along the South line of Tyler County; Thence, N. 03
’ W., 100 feet, along the West line of said A-87, to the Point of Beginning.
